title: CCC Quiz
description: Course on Computer Concepts - Basic computer literacy and digital skills

questions.question: What does CCC stand for?
questions.explanation: CCC stands for Course on Computer Concepts, a basic computer literacy program by NIELIT.

questions.question: Which organization conducts CCC examination?
questions.explanation: NIELIT (National Institute of Electronics & Information Technology) conducts CCC examinations.

questions.question: What is the full form of CPU?
questions.explanation: CPU stands for Central Processing Unit, the brain of the computer.

questions.question: Which of the following is an input device?
questions.explanation: Keyboard is an input device used to enter data into the computer.

questions.question: What is the full form of RAM?
questions.explanation: RAM stands for Random Access Memory, temporary storage for running programs.

questions.question: Which is the default word processor in LibreOffice?
questions.explanation: LibreOffice Writer is the word processing application in LibreOffice suite.

questions.question: What is the file extension for LibreOffice Writer documents?
questions.explanation: .odt (OpenDocument Text) is the default file format for LibreOffice Writer.

questions.question: Which key combination is used to save a document in LibreOffice?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + S is the universal shortcut to save documents in LibreOffice applications.

questions.question: What does WWW stand for?
questions.explanation: WWW stands for World Wide Web, a system of interlinked hypertext documents.

questions.question: Which protocol is used for secure web browsing?
questions.explanation: HTTPS (HyperText Transfer Protocol Secure) is used for secure web communication.

questions.question: What is an email address?
questions.explanation: Email address is a unique identifier used to send and receive electronic mail.

questions.question: Which symbol is mandatory in every email address?
questions.explanation: @ (at) symbol is mandatory in every email address to separate username and domain.

questions.question: What is a web browser?
questions.explanation: Web browser is software used to access and view websites on the internet.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT an operating system?
questions.explanation: MS Office is application software, not an operating system.

questions.question: What is the function of an operating system?
questions.explanation: Operating system manages hardware, software, and provides user interface.

questions.question: Which device is used to point and click on screen?
questions.explanation: Mouse is a pointing device used to click and navigate on screen.

questions.question: What is the full form of URL?
questions.explanation: URL stands for Uniform Resource Locator, the address of a web resource.

questions.question: Which application in LibreOffice is used for presentations?
questions.explanation: LibreOffice Impress is used for creating and editing presentations.

questions.question: What is a computer virus?
questions.explanation: Computer virus is malicious software that can damage or corrupt data.

questions.question: Which storage device has the largest capacity?
questions.explanation: Hard disk typically has the largest storage capacity among these options.
